subject: Re: [junit] Running test methods in a test case in seperate VM's and in order

messageBody:
John,

This shouldn't be too hard, although it'll require a little hacking. If
it were my task, I'd first write a class that instantiates a TestCase
for a single method:

void main(String[] argv) {
TestResult result = new TestResult();
TestCase case = Class.forName(argv[0]).newInstance(argv[1]);
case.run(result);
// output result somehow
}

Then, you can create a wrapper that invokes this for each test you're
interested in. Is that a start?

David Saff

johnlukar wrote:

>
> Is this possible ?
>
> My problem is that I have a Unit test that does performance
> benchmarking of a product.
>
> Each test method tests one aspect of the product. The problem is the
> VM performs full GC collection due to the memory being chewed up in a
> single VM invocation that runs all testMethods.
>
>
> This subsequently results in erronous perfromance times and stats.
>
> so I'd like to run each testMethod in its own VM, and to avoid
> multiple parallel test methods running and chewing up the memory, I
> think I need to run the methods in order.
>
> any ideas ?
>
> thanks much in advance for info.
>
